name: path-go-to-definition
description: Extends the "Go to Definition" (F12) action to support file paths in strings

pathGoToDefinition.projectRootRegex.description: The regex to use when checking for paths that are relative to the project's root directory. Matches the whole string.

pathGoToDefinition.relativeRegex.description: The regex to use when checking for paths that are relative to the directory the file is in. Matches the whole string.

pathGoToDefinition.langWhitelist.description: Language IDs that the extension should handle. If empty, all languages are handled.

pathGoToDefinition.filenameWhitelist.description: If any of the regex patterns in the array match the relative path of a document, the extension will be active for that document. If empty, no checks are performed.

pathGoToDefinition.specific.description: Allows for specialized configuration sets for different languages or file types.

language.description: The language ID that this specific configuration set matches.

path.description: The regular expression to match against the file path to determine whether this configuration set applies.

projectRootRegex.description: The regex to use when checking for paths that are relative to the project's root directory. Matches the whole string. If null or empty, uses the global default.

relativeRegex.description: The regex to use when checking for paths that are relative to the directory the file is in. Matches the whole string. If null or empty, uses the global default.

defaultFile.description: If a path points to a directory, the extension will navigate to the file with this name in that directory.

scripts.pretest: yarn run compile && yarn run lint
